column1: TAI Erlang Autonomics - Financial Projection Model
DETAILED UNIT ECONOMICS - BASE CASE YEAR 1
If acquisition slows 50%: Still cash positive by Month 24 with Series A funding
If acquisition accelerates 50%: Cash positive by Month 15
COHORT ANALYSIS - YEAR 1 BASE CASE CUSTOMERS
Note: Strong retention (100%) assumed based on high LTV/CAC ratio and customer success playbook
NRR (Net Retention Rate): Shows expansion revenue from upgrades
- $3K CAC (vs $3.5K base): +$200K more customers by Y3
- $5K CAC (vs $3.5K base): -$150K fewer customers by Y3
- 95% margin (vs 98.8% base): -$120K impact (less likely given SaaS model)
Conclusion: Sales cycle and ACV have largest sensitivity. Focus on shortening sales cycle and moving customers upmarket.
